creator: jdriller@orchid.org
text:
I had a corrupted older version which I uninstalled, restarted and then 
installed the newer version. I had run Cold Fusion 4.5 and the module with it 
before. I am installed on my G drive and docroot on a dif partition. I am on 
win2k (build 2195) server pro on a toshiba tecra laptop. 

I get an error 'The procedure entry point_apr_dynamic_fn_retrieve@4 could not 
be located in dynamic link library libaprutil.dll.'.

On reinstall I still had and use my old httpd.conf.

creator: jdriller@orchid.org
text:
Oh, and when I open the services to see what is going on - no apache service is 
yet running...

creator: jdriller@orchid.org
text:
It looks like the installer did not do things cleanly. I did not go in and look 
at files and sizes but when I did the usual Wintel reinstall process the 3rd 
time with a freshly downloaded .msi it worked. As I recall I tried doing a 
custom install the first two times and then did a default automatic install 
which did the trick the 3rd time. So, it may pay to look into the custom 
options install if you get more of these issues. All these installs were with 
the 2.0.44 .msi with no ssl and not checked by mp5/rsa keys. It *did* appear 
that my old httpd.conf was being used when it did not work but that was 
overwritten on the install that did....I hope that helps.

I'm afraid we simply provide a list of resources in the .msi, and it's up
  to the microsoft installer to roll them back cleanly.  Presume this is
  a bug in your version of the msi installer, or you still had a service
  running when it attempted to uninstall (we shut down and delete the one
  we create at install time.)
creator: wrowe@apache.org
